about
photo

I am a software developer currently based in Austin, TX looking for her next new adventure. I love the creativity and ingenuity required for the solving problem aspect to programming and the natural high that immediately follows after solving a particularly difficult one.

When I'm not coding or experimenting with a new tool, I can be found at a cozy cafe reading newspapers front to back, sacrificing myself to find the best apple pie in town in everyone's place, bellowing out Disney tunes and trying to fulfill my life's goal of helping others.

PORTFOLIO

WeatherVain

iOS Application

WeatherVain

WeatherVain

iOS Application

WeatherVain

iOS Application
CONTACT
  • WeatherVain
  • iOS Application


Awards: "Best Overall App" and "Most Original Idea" @ 2014 UT Apps Demo Day

Dates: January 2014 - April 2014

Team: Six members consisting of three CS an three Journalism students.

Tools Used: Xcode 5, Objective-C, TestFlight, CocoaPods, Parse, OpenWeatherMap API, Trello, Github, Git, Photoshop CS5, Illustrator, Final Cut Pro

Role: On the computer science students' end, we had a little less than two months to pick up iOS development without any instruction. My job was to tie everything together, in both a programming aspect and a UI/Front-End aspect, with the use of Parse and Cocoapods. I also developed the outfit matching algorithm that maneuvers the clothing database, taking into consideration the "feels like" temperature with respect to wind speed, the average temperature within a scope of X hours, the user rating system of individual items of clothing, and the cohesiveness of the clothes themselves. here ended up being over 5000 outfit possibilities. We collectively also taught non-programmer teammates how to code.

Value:
1. Communication & Problem Solving - This fast-paced class makes you fully realize that people naturally think differently. It forces you to learn how to be a better communicator and pushes you be a team player. It gave us a sense of the real world work environment.

2. Quick Learning - It taught us to learn and adapt quickly. We had a little less than two months to pick up iOS mobile development. It was either pick it up very quickly by investing time outside of classes or not have an app ready by demo day.
